article.description: Julius Hodge had 24 points and six rebounds Saturday as North Carolina State (No. 25 ESPN/USA Today) rebounded from its first loss by beating Fairleigh Dickinson 104-65.
article.headline: Wolfpack get right back to winning
article.linkText: Wolfpack respond by ripping Fairleigh Dickinson
article.story:
RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Julius Hodge had 24 points and six rebounds
Saturday as North Carolina State (No. 25 ESPN/USA Today) rebounded from its first loss by
beating Fairleigh Dickinson 104-65.

	   Marcus Melvin had 15 points and Cameron Bennerman added 14 for
the Wolfpack (6-1), who improved to 33-2 against nonconference foes
at the RBC Center.

	   N.C. State was coming off a 69-60 loss to Gonzaga in the Jimmy V
Classic on Tuesday, a game in which it shot 27 percent and was
outrebounded 61-35.

	   The Wolfpack was never in any danger Saturday, jumping to a
double-digit lead against the Knights (4-3) in the first seven
minutes. N.C. State shot 58 percent and took a 35-28 edge on the
glass.

	   Lionel Bomayako had 20 points to lead Fairleigh Dickinson, which
was coming off a 104-66 loss at No. 25 Minnesota.

	   The Wolfpack shot 55.6 percent in the first half and hit 6 of 15
3-point tries, cruising to a 55-31 halftime lead. The Wolfpack
opened the second half with 12 unanswered points, ending with a
jumper from Marcus Melvin for a 67-31 lead with 17:43 to play.

	   During that spurt, the Wolfpack's aggressive fullcourt defense
locked down, forcing three turnovers -- two in the backcourt that
led to immediate scores -- to key the surge.

	   The Wolfpack pushed the lead to 40 on a two-handed slam from
Melvin off a pass from Dominick Mejia with 7:20 to play. N.C. State
hit the 100-point mark on a one-handed slam from Bennerman with
just over a minute left, setting off cheers from the sparse crowd
of 9,679.

	   N.C. State forced 23 turnovers and recorded 14 steals.
